Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery mug; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior reserved save for narrow dilute brown and streaky black bands around flat base.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Hamilton College, Clinton (NY). This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For shape and decoration parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.499.h. According to Williams' typology (1983, 178), the mug fits into his Type A and into Boardman's (1967,126) Type B. Boardman, J., Excavations in Chios 1952-1955. Greek Emporio. Annual of the British School at Athens Supplement 6. Oxford 1967. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2218) (phase 3)
